meta.content: This afternoon, Governor Inslee announced his Executive Order to close all schools from March 17 through April 24. This means all Port Angeles School District schools will be open and operating on a regular schedule Monday, March 16th and then closed thereafter.

nav.div: Port Angeles School District » News » Health Notices » Port Angeles School District Closure

img.title: Port Angeles School District Closure
img.p: This will be the first of several communications over the coming days based on the rapidly evolving coronavirus situation.

This afternoon, Governor Inslee announced his Executive Order to close all schools from March 17 through April 24. This means all Port Angeles School District schools will be open and operating on a regular schedule Monday, March 16th and then closed thereafter.

We know this raises all kinds of questions and implications including childcare needs for our staff and families, school meals, graduation, and much more. We are working on plans to address a range of impacts, and we will be in constant communication as we work through these issues.
We will be planning for an alternative model with the following services:

ul.li: Available childcare during school hours for families who serve in critical community roles such as healthcare and first responders.
Available meals for children provided at school sites – details to follow.
Available educational resources with supports for at-home learning.

img.p: We recognize this closure creates many different challenges, and our goal is to provide basic services to continue supporting our families and our community. We will continue to provide updated information over the next several days, and we would ask for your patience in submitting any questions or concerns.

div.div: Port Angeles School District | 905 W. 9th Street, Port Angeles, WA 98363 | Phone 360-457-8575 | Fax 360-457-0795

p.strong: Port Angeles School District is an Equal Opportunity Employer

span.p: Port Angeles School District does not discriminate in any programs or activities on the basis of sex, race, creed, religion, color, national origin, age, veteran or military status, sexual orientation, gender expression or identity, disability, or the use of a trained dog guide or service animal and provides equal access to the Boy Scouts and other designated youth groups. The following employees have been designated to handle questions and complaints of alleged discrimination: Title IX Coordinators, Civil Rights Compliance Coordinators: Scott Harker, 905 W. 9th Street Port Angeles, WA 98363, (360) 457-8575, sharker@portangelesschools.org, for Section 504/ADA Coordinator, Pamela Sanford, 905 W. 9th Street Port Angeles, WA 98363, (360) 457-8575, psanford@portangelesschools.org.
Please visit our page on Complaint Procedures for more information.

For questions or concerns regarding the PASD website or subsidiary pages please contact Webmaster.
